SafetyInspectionBy: Missouri Dept. of Ag. Dean Richards

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This facility complies with OSHA 29CFR 1910.111 requirements for Anhydrous Ammonia storage and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Holt County LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency.

This facility is an unmanned satellite storage plant.  Employees are there only to load and unload on an irregular basis.  Emergency phone numbers and contact personnel are posted.  This facility is a retail fertilizer plant.  We sell anhydrous ammonia to area farmers for fertilizing purposes.  This operation consists of one 18,000-gallon ammonia tank and associated piping, valves and compressors.

Our worst case scenario is failure of the 18,000-gallon storage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed.  According to EPA look-up tables, the distance to the endpoint is 4.9 miles.  Within the distance to the endpoint, there is a total population of 500 people.

This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local rules and regulations.  The ammonia system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with OSHA 29CFR 1910.111 and state law.

We have never had an accident involving ammonia that caused death, injury, property or environmental damage, evacuation or shelterings in place. 

In the event of an emergency involving our ammonia system, it is our policy to notify the Holt County LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency.

With our ongoing safety training and maintenance programs, and under present regulations, we do not anticipate any changes needed in our safety program at this time.
